summary: Federal reports on Native American youth found challenges—such as poverty and exposure to violence—that can make them susceptible to being arrested, charged, or sentenced in the justice system. Among other things, we found: Overall rates of Native American juvenile delinquency declined 2010-2016. While most of the Native American youth in the system were at the state or local level, they were overrepresented in the federal...
title: Native American Youth: Involvement in Justice Systems and Information on Grants to Help Address Juvenile Delinquency
